exceptions.exn: [Focus] Wrong bullet -: Current bullet - is not finished.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
q: nat
p: nat

Goal:
q <> 0 -> divides p q -> 1 <= p <= q

Premises:
divides = fun n k : nat => exists p : nat, k = p * n : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments divides (_ _)%nat_scope
divides_le : forall p q : nat, q <> 0 -> divides p q -> p <= q
bezout_rel_prime_lt : forall p q : nat, 0 < p < q -> is_gcd p q 1 -> {a : nat & {b : nat | a * p + b * q = 1 + p * q /\ a <= q /\ b <= p}}
prime = fun p : nat => p <> 1 /\ (forall q : nat, divides q p -> q = 1 \/ q = p) : nat -> Prop Arguments prime _%nat_scope
divides_mult_inv : forall k p q : nat, k <> 0 -> divides (k * p) (k * q) -> divides p q
plus_le_compat : forall n m p q : nat, n <= m -> p <= q -> n + p <= m + q
mult_le_compat : forall n m p q : nat, n <= m -> p <= q -> n * p <= m * q
is_gcd_modulus : forall p q k r : nat, divides p k -> k <= q -> is_gcd p q r -> is_gcd p (q - k) r
bezout_sc : forall p q a b m : nat, a * p + b * q = 1 + m -> divides p m \/ divides q m -> is_gcd p q 1
prime_gcd : forall p q : nat, prime p -> is_gcd p q 1 \/ divides p q
is_rel_prime_div : forall p q k : nat, is_gcd p q 1 -> divides p (q * k) -> divides p k
is_rel_prime_div_r : forall p q k : nat, is_gcd p q 1 -> divides p (k * q) -> divides p k
prime_or_div : forall p : nat, 2 <= p -> {q : nat | 2 <= q < p /\ divides q p} + {prime p}
div_rem_spec2 : forall q p : nat, p <> 0 -> rem q p < p
div_ge_1 : forall p : nat, p <> 0 -> forall n : nat, p <= n -> 1 <= div n p
mult_is_one : forall p q : nat, p * q = 1 -> p = 1 /\ q = 1
divides_div : forall q p : nat, divides p q -> q = div q p * p
is_gcd_div : forall p q : nat, divides p q -> is_gcd p q p
power_ge_1 : forall k p : nat, p <> 0 -> 1 <= mscal Init.Nat.mul 1 k p
divides_rem_congr : forall p q a b : nat, divides p q -> rem a q = rem b q -> rem a p = rem b p
is_gcd_0 : forall p q : nat, is_gcd p q 0 -> p = 0 /\ q = 0
is_gcd = fun p q r : nat => divides r p /\ divides r q /\ (forall k : nat, divides k p -> divides k q -> divides k r) : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments is_gcd (_ _ _)%nat_scope
is_lcm = fun p q r : nat => divides p r /\ divides q r /\ (forall k : nat, divides p k -> divides q k -> divides r k) : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments is_lcm (_ _ _)%nat_scope
bezout_nc : forall p q : nat, is_gcd p q 1 -> exists a b : nat, a * p + b * q = 1 + p * q
divides_mult_r : forall p q k : nat, divides p q -> divides p (q * k)
divides_mult : forall p q k : nat, divides p q -> divides p (k * q)
divides_mult_inv_l : forall p q r : nat, divides (p * q) r -> divides p r /\ divides q r
is_gcd_moduplus : forall p q k r : nat, divides p k -> is_gcd p q r -> is_gcd p (q + k) r
divides_rem_eq : forall q p : nat, divides p q < -> rem q p = 0
bezout_generalized_lt : forall p q : nat, 0 < p < q -> {a : nat & {b : nat & {g : nat & {l : nat & {u : nat & {v : nat | a * p + b * q = g + l /\ is_gcd p q g /\ is_lcm p q l /\ p = u * g /\ q = v * g /\ a <= v /\ b <= u}}}}}}
divides_rem_rem : forall p q a : nat, divides p q -> rem (rem a q) p = rem a p
no_common_prime_is_coprime : forall x y : nat, x <> 0 -> (forall p : nat, prime p -> divides p x -> divides p y -> False) -> is_gcd x y 1
is_gcd_fun : forall p q r1 r2 : nat, is_gcd p q r1 -> is_gcd p q r2 -> r1 = r2
Nat.add_lt_mono : forall n m p q : nat, n < m -> p < q -> n + p < m + q
is_gcd_sym : forall p q r : nat, is_gcd p q r -> is_gcd q p r
is_lcm_sym : forall p q r : nat, is_lcm p q r -> is_lcm q p r
div_prop : forall q p n r : nat, q = n * p + r -> r < p -> div q p = n
rem_prop : forall q p n r : nat, q = n * p + r -> r < p -> rem q p = r
gcd.divides_fact : forall m p : nat, 1 < p <= m -> divides p (Factorial.fact m)
is_lcm_moduplus : forall k p q g l u : nat, p = u * g -> is_gcd p q g -> is_lcm p q l -> is_lcm p (q + k * p) (l + k * u * p)
Nat.mul_le_mono_nonneg_r : forall n m p : nat, 0 <= p -> n <= m -> n * p <= m * p

```coq
intros q p H1 H2.
assert (H3: p <= q).
{ apply divides_le; assumption. }
split.
- apply div_ge_1; assumption.
- assumption.
Qed.
```

original: intros q p H1 H2. assert (H3: p <= q). { apply divides_le; auto. } split. - apply div_ge_1; auto. - auto.
